summary: Child workflows are not respecting the WorkflowIdConflictPolicy.USE_EXISTING setting and throw WorkflowExecutionAlreadyStartedError when attempting to start a child workflow with an existing ID. The server doesn't support conflict policies for child workflows, making this SDK exposure incorrect.
userImpact: Users cannot reuse child workflow IDs with the intended conflict policy, causing runtime errors when attempting to start existing child workflows.
rootCause: The TypeScript SDK exposed WorkflowIdConflictPolicy option for child workflows, but the Temporal server does not support conflict policies for child workflows.
resolutionDetails: The issue was identified as an SDK API exposure problem - the option should not have been available since the server doesn't support this feature for child workflows.
keyQuote: The server doesn't support conflict policies for child workflows, the TypeScript SDK shouldn't have exposed this option.
